name: Sofitel Sydney Wentworth

reviews.text: Stayed 3 nights in January 2007, on a breakfast included rate.
reviews.title: Highly recommend.

reviews.text: The Sofitel Wentworth is a lovely place to stay right in the heart of Sydney. A stroll away from the Opera House and Circular Quay, a stones throw away from the shopping district.
reviews.title: Great stay at the Sofitel

likes.disliked: — Lack of views is the only downside.

reviews.text: Right from the check in the staff could not have been more helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: Great business hotel

reviews.text: We were in room 1114 which was a junior suite. Given some of the slightly negatvice reviews here I was a little apprehensive as this was an important occasion for my wife and I. I shouldn't have worried!
reviews.title: Room not up to snuff for Sofitel brand

reviews.text: The lounge area was skinny but well appointed, furnishings were all of a very high quality. The bedroom was a good size with a very classy feel, features included; a beautiful timber wardrobe/entertainment unit, side tables with an ambient night light which was a thoughtful inclusion, last but not least the bed was one of the most comfortable we have slept in.
reviews.title: Value light

reviews.text: The bathroom was very clean and well appointed with seperate shower and bath, nice marble finishes were all appreciated.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

description: Sydney's time-honoured five-star hotel in the heart of the shopping and business district has a solid reputation for impeccable service and incomparable elegance. The recent renovations artfully combine the latest in modern convenience with the old-worldcharm that has made it an architectural icon. The hotel boasts premier conference facilities,a fabulous health club and complete day spa. Experience haute cuisine at the restaurant or slip into the lounge for an afternoon tea or an intimate night cap.
